org.apache.hive.hcatalog.api.repl

Interface Command

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DropDatabaseCommand, DropPartitionCommand, DropTableCommand, ExportCommand, ImportCommand, NoopCommand

    @InterfaceAudience.Public
 @InterfaceStability.Stable
public interface Command
extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable
    Interface that abstracts the notion of one atomic command to execute. If the command does not execute and raises some exception, then Command provides a conditional to check if the operation is intended to be retriable - i.e. whether the command is considered idempotent. If it is, then the user could attempt to redo the particular command they were running. If not, then they can check another conditional to check if their action is undo-able. If undoable, then they can then attempt to undo the action by asking the command how to undo it. If not, they can then in turn act upon the exception in whatever manner they see fit (typically by raising an error). We also have two more methods that help cleanup of temporary locations used by this Command. cleanupLocationsPerRetry() provides a list of directories that are intended to be cleaned up every time this Command needs to be retried. cleanupLocationsAfterEvent() provides a list of directories that should be cleaned up after the event for which this Command is generated is successfully processed.
